Friday, May 15, 2020.
We are hopeful to return to school on
Monday, May 18, 2020, more info here.

tr.td: Help our community get the resourcesÂ it needs for the next 10 years by taking 10 minutes to complete the 2020 Census.Â The results will impact funding and planning for local schools, libraries, emergency services and infrastructure. Make sure to include everyone living in your home, especially your Cincinnatus Central School students!Â Responding now online atÂ 2020census.gov, by phone or by mail will minimize the need for the Census Bureau to send Census Takers to your home to follow up. We're all counting on you!"

span.span: Parent or caregiver who needs child care

i.style: color: rgb(32, 31, 30); font-family: "segoe ui","segoe ui web (west european)","segoe ui",-apple-system,blinkmacsystemfont,"roboto","helvetica neue",sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

td.i: If you are a parent or caregiver who needs child care, please complete this parent need for child care survey. Based on the information you provide about your job, employer, number of children, and financial need, OCFS may be able to help you find the child program you need. It may be a challenge to find child care due to COVID-19 related program closures, however the staff at OCFS are trying their best to support families to find the high quality child care that they need.

h3.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;

span.strong: FREE ONLINE BOOKS FOR OUR STUDENTS

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;
div.br: Renaissance is pleased to offer free access to myON digital reading resources for students and families during the current COVID-19 school closures.Â

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;
div.br:
Students who are not already reading with their own personalized accounts to the myON literacy environment are welcome to log in through a single, shared account, to access this collection of curated resources.
Whatâs available:
â¢Â Â Â Â The myON digital libraryâwhich includes thousands of authentic digital books, fiction and nonfiction, covering a variety of topics and themes
â¢Â Â Â Â Five daily myON News articlesâwhich are written for students by journalists and reviewed by a child psychologist for age appropriateness
These resources are available 24/7 and can be accessed on any digital device that is connected to the Internet. Books from the myON digital library can be downloaded onto mobile devices for offline reading, as well.
How to log into myON:Â
1.Â Â Â Go to:Â www.myon.com
2.Â Â Â Click the login button at the top of the screen
3.Â Â Â Enter the following information on the login page
School name:Â New York Reads
(begin typing and click on the school from the drop-down menu)
Username: read
Password: books
Resources to share with students and families:
â¢Â Â Â Â What is myON?Â - provides more information about these resources-
https://p.widencdn.net/esuxzy/380099-What-is-myON-2
â¢Â Â Â Â Welcome to myON video - provides step-by-step instructions for logging in and reading with myON -
https://p.widencdn.net/gjindp/Intro-to-myON-Books-and-News
â¢Â Â Â Â Offline reading tip sheet - provides instructions for accessing, setting up, and reading offline using free myON mobile apps-Â https://p.widencdn.net/gklgfn/380099-Offline-Tip-Sheet-myON-Shared-Acc-2
â¢Â Â Â Â Reading myON books offline video - offers step-by-step instructions for selecting and using the appropriate myON mobile app-Â https://p.widencdn.net/mxcufo/Reading-Offline-with-myON
â¢Â Â Â Â At-home family reading activities - provides suggestions for supporting and sharing in your studentsâ reading experiences-Â https://p.widencdn.net/fmrdox/380099-myON-At-home-family-activities-2

March 23, 2020.Â Continue to check our website for updates and community resources.

GRADES 5 - 12 Students in Grades 5 -12 still in need of a Chromebook, please

h6.a:
Important Updates Regarding COVID-19 & FederalÂ
Nutrition Programs

span.style: display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); color: rgb(31, 31, 31); font-family: "Work Sans",sans-serif; font-size: 22px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 300; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;
font-family:Lucida Sans Unicode,Lucida Grande,sans-serif;

text-align: left; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; float: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.span: For students in grades 5th & 6th, you may come to school with an adult family member tomorrow, Friday, March 20 between 9:00 and 11:00 am to pick up a Chromebook to use for schoolÂ work. If you are a householdÂ of two students and your older siblingÂ already has a Chromebook at home, then please share the one you already have. If three or more students in grades 5 - 12 are in the same household then stop by. Please use the Visitor Center Entrance.Â

br.a: Cortland County SchoolsÂ Student Meal Distribution Plan

tr.td: On Wednesday, March 18, 2020, when students come for materials, they will be able to pick up a student lunch for Wednesday and a breakfast for Thursday to take home.

Corona Virus Letter updateÂ 2

tr.td:
All school events are cancelled effective today through Monday,Â April 13, 2020.
Classes will resume on Tuesday, April 14, 2020.Â
